Cache#

A asynccore.cache is responsible for storing data such as channels, servers or even messages.#

class asynccore.cache.Cache(session, user, endpoint)[source]#

Bases: object

A Cache object is assigned to each asynccore.user.UserClient object. It stores servers, channels, messages. The startup function acquires all data (except messages) at startup if startup_cache in class asynccore.client.Client is set to True

Parameters:

  • session (CustomSession) – Store the session object that is passed to it

  • user (UserClient) – Store the user’s client

  • endpoint (str) – Set the endpoint of the api

add_channel_to_cache(channel_data)[source]#

The add_channel_to_cache function adds a channel to the cache.

Parameters:

channel_data (dict) – Pass the channel data

Return type:

None

add_guild_to_cache(guild_data)[source]#

The add_guild_to_cache function adds a guild to the cache.

Parameters:

guild_data (dict) – Pass dictionary of guild data

Return type:

None

add_message_to_cache(message_data)[source]#

The add_message_to_cache function adds a message to the cache.

Parameters:

message_data (dict) – Pass in the message data that is to be added to the cache

Return type:

None

get_channel(channel_id, guild_id=None)[source]#

The get_channel function is used to retrieve a channel’s data from the cache.

Parameters:

  • channel_id (int) – Get the channel id of a specific channel

  • guild_id (Optional[int]) – Specify the guild id of the channel

Return type:

Optional[dict]

get_channels(guild_id)[source]#

The get_channels function returns a list of channels for the given guild_id. If no channels are found, it will return None.

Parameters:

guild_id (int) – Get the channels from a specific guild

Return type:

Optional[list[dict]]

get_guild(guild_id)[source]#

The get_guild function is used to get a guild’s data from the cache. It takes in a guild_id and returns the corresponding dictionary of that guild’s data. If no such dictionary exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

guild_id (int) – Specify the id of the guild you want to get information about

Return type:

Optional[dict]

get_guilds()[source]#

The get_guilds function returns a list of dictionaries containing the guilds that the account is in. The dictionary contains information about each guild, such as its name and ID.

Return type:

list[dict]

get_message(guild_id, message_id)[source]#

The get_message function is used to retrieve a message from the cache.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – Specify the guild id of the message

  • message_id (int) – Find the message in the list of messages

Return type:

Optional[dict]

get_messages(guild_id)[source]#

The get_messages function returns a list of messages from the cache.

Parameters:

guild_id (int) – Get the messages from a specific guild

Return type:

Optional[list[dict]]

get_messages_from_channel(guild_id, channel_id)[source]#

The get_messages_from_channel function takes a guild_id and channel_id, and returns all messages from the specified channel. If no messages are found, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – Get the messages from a specific guild

  • channel_id (int) – Get the messages from a specific channel

Return type:

Optional[list[Optional[dict]]]

await startup_cache()[source]#

The startup_cache function is called when the account starts up. It checks if there are any cached guilds, and if not, it requests them from Discord. Then it requests channels from Discord.

Note

The function will only get called if the startup_cache parameter is set to True in the asynccore.client.Client class.

update_channel(guild_id, channel_data)[source]#

The update_channel function is used to update the cached channel for a guild.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – Pass guild_id

  • channel_data (dict) – Pass the updated channel_data

Return type:

None

update_guild(guild_data)[source]#

The update_guild function updates the cached guilds list with a new guild data.

Parameters:

guild_data (dict) – Pass in the guild data

Return type:

None

update_message(guild_id, message_data)[source]#

The update_message function is used to update a message in the cache.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – Specify the guild id of the message

  • message_data (dict) – Updated message data

Return type:

None

class asynccore.cache.CacheEventHandler(response, user)[source]#

Bases: object

CacheEventHandler handles the caching of events. For example, when the gateway receives a response about a new message this class will add this message to the cache.

Parameters:

  • response (GatewayResponse) – Store the gatewayresponse object that was passed to the gateway

  • user (UserClient) – Get the user object who recived response

get_args()[source]#

The get_args function is needed to get the arguments to call events like on_message_edit It gets the before_data argument from the cache and then updates the cache

Return type:

Optional[tuple]

handle_cache()[source]#

Function checks if the event name is either MESSAGE_CREATE or CHANNEL_CREATE, and then adds that data to the cache.
